titleStmt.title: The Grand question resolved, viz. a king having protested to defend to the uttermost of his power, the true Protestant religion, with the rights and liberties of all his subjects but if they, fearing that he will violate this his protestation, take up arms to prevent it, what may be judged hereof?

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
